etymology.description: semantic: 大(大) (dà, "big") + phonetic: 可(可) (kě, "to allow") = something that can be unusually large or remarkable -> strange or unique
etymology.interpretation: The character 奇(奇) (qí, "strange") combines 大(大) (dà, "big") as its semantic component, suggesting size or prominence, with 可(可) (kě, "to allow") as a phonetic component, indicating sound and the possibility of something being unusual or distinctive.

examples.chinese: 他的想法真奇(他的想法真奇)。
他戴了一顶奇帽(他戴了一頂奇帽)。
examples.pinyin: Tā dài le yī dǐng qí mào.

examples.chinese: 空中的云彩形状奇(空中的雲彩形狀奇)，令人联想到梦幻世界(令人聯想到夢幻世界)。
examples.pinyin: Kōng zhōng de yún cǎi xíng zhuàng qí, lìng rén liánxiǎng dào mènghuàn shì jiè.
examples.english: The shapes of the clouds in the sky are peculiar, evoking a dreamlike world.
